q:
Suppose you have developed a Spring Boot application and it is now time to push it to production. You decide to take advantage of the Spring Boot Actuator which comes with a number of ready features. Since some endpoints may contain confidential information you want to manually make some changes. You have to expose everything over HTTP. For that, you have the following options to choose from.

  1. management.endpoints.web.exposure.include=all
  2. management.endpoints.http.exposure.include=*
  3. management.endpoints.http.exposure.exclude=*
  4. management.endpoints.web.exposure.include=*

Choose the correct option to Accomplish the mentioned task?

Suppose you are working on building spring boot applications. Testing is an important step to find how the application is working. In your application, there is one package namely “MyPackage”. It has many classes and functions. Among them, “MainPage” controller is the key class. From this page, everything is interconnected. Database testing is already done based on the logic. From the above info, your task is to only test the “MainPage” controller separately. You shouldn't have to call each and every class but only “MainPage”. For this, you might need to instantiate the class first. Choose the function from the below options to do this task.

1. @SpringBootTest(MainPage.class)

2. @ContextConfiguration(MainPage.class)

3. @SpringBootStarterTest(MainPage.class)

4. @WebMvcTest(MainPage.class)

Suppose you are working on building spring boot applications. As the last step, you need to test that application. This application consists of various packages. In each package, there are a few classes written. The methods present in each class is interlinked and maybe called by a different class of the same package or any other package in the system. Based on the structure of the application, you need to test the application by each method or each class. You have to perform independently. What kind of testing do you want to use to do this process?

Suppose you are working on testing spring boot applications. You have to test your application using a dependency called “Spring boot starter test” which will hold all the required elements for testing. Now, from the above info, you have to choose the correct statements from below.

1. It is the primary dependency

2. It has AssertJ as an inbuilt library

3. Mockito framework is not supported

Suppose you are working on testing spring boot applications. You have written code for building application. The built application has many layers in it. Which testing method is useful to do in this case?

ABC is a food aggregator who is advertising that it can deliver an order in 40 minutes or less on an average providing that the delivery location is within a 5 km radius from the restaurant where the order is placed.

The mean delivery time is 42.3 and the p-value is 2.5e-06. 

 Assume that the delivery distribution is approximately normal. Which of the following statements about this scenario is correct: 

  1. The null hypothesis is rejected at 5% level of significance. Hence, at 5% level of significance, there is not enough evidence that the mean delivery time within 5 km radius is actually 40 min or less, as claimed by ABC in their advertisement.
  2. The null hypothesis is accepted at 5% level of significance. Hence, at 5% level of significance, there is enough evidence that the mean delivery time within 5 km radius is actually 40 min or less, as claimed by ABC in their advertisement.
  3. The null hypothesis is rejected at 10% level of significance. Hence, at 10% level of significance, there is enough evidence that the mean delivery time within 5 km radius is actually 40 min or less, as claimed by ABC in their advertisement.

In Machine Learning, which of the following statements about hypothesis testing and confidence interval is correct:

  1. If the \(100(1 – α)\%\) confidence interval of a population parameter does not include null value of a parameter, then the null hypothesis is rejected at \(100α\%\) level of significance.
  2. If the \(100α\%\) confidence interval of a population parameter does not include null value of a parameter, then the null hypothesis is rejected at \(100(1-α)\%\) level of significance.
  3. If the \(100(1 – α)\%\) confidence interval of a population parameter does not include null value of a parameter, then the null hypothesis is accepted at \(100α\%\) level of significance.
  4. If the \(100(1 – α)\%\) confidence interval of a population parameter includes null value of a parameter, then the null hypothesis is rejected at \(100α\%\) level of significance.

In UI testing, which of the following testing strategies integrates the set of classes that are required to respond to one input or event for the system?
Which agile tools and frameworks supports automated acceptance testing?
In agile testing, which of the following techniques is used for the dynamic systems development method?
In agile testing, which of the following statements is the valid core value of the agile software development process?

a.option: It creates individual interactions over different processes and tools.
It facilitates a working software over comprehensive documentation.
It does not allow to change the previously set plan.

q: In agile testing, what is a tracer bullet?

a.option: It is used to examine an end to end process for feasibility.
It is used to resolve technical issues.
It is used to maintain projects that involve frequent changes.

a.option: Kanban board (Visual and persistent across the development)

q: What are the principles of the agile testing technique?

a.option: Testing is not a phase but a continuous process
Decreases the time taken for feedback responses

q: In test manager testing, which of the following methodologies is used to perform the conformance testing?

In software testing, which of the following statements about the defect triage process is correct?

a.option: It is a process where each bug is prioritized based on its severity, frequency, risk, and many more attributes.
It is used to evaluate, prioritize, and assign the resolution of defects.
It is used in software testing processes to define the severity and priority of new defects.

q: In agile testing methodologies, which of the following development processes produces code to pass a software test?
In scrum testing, what is the timeframe for a sprint to complete user stories?

In scrum development, what is the significance of the following statement:

The sprint burn-down metrics is less

a.option: Teams need to take more work
Teams need to take less work
